judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The appeal is quashed as interlocutory and the matter is remanded to the court below for disposition of the exceptions filed on behalf of Sofia Haniak. The attention of the parties is directed to onr recent decision in Demczuk Estate, 444 Pa. 212, 282 A. 2d 700 (1971). Costs on the estate.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William D. Hutchinson, with him Chester C. Corse, Jr., and Williamson, Friedberg & Jones, for appellant.
Vincent J. Doplco, Deputy Attorney General, with him Eugene J. Anastasio, Deputy Attorney General, and J. Shane Creamer, Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Haniak Estate.
Argued May 25, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
William D. Hutchinson, with him Chester C. Corse, Jr., and Williamson, Friedberg & Jones, for appellant.
Vincent J. Doplco, Deputy Attorney General, with him Eugene J. Anastasio, Deputy Attorney General, and J. Shane Creamer, Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
December 20, 1971:
